alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 10:20PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Creek flooding caused by runoff from prior excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 PM EST, stream gauge along Duck Creek in Whipple indicates minor flooding is occurring due to runoff from earlier rains. - The creek level should continue to slowly fall over the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marietta, Williamstown, Lower Salem and Devola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
